name: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
culture: Traditional honey collectors, tiger trackers, and boat communities
story: Home to the Royal Bengal Tiger and ancient fishing communities practicing centuries-old traditions that will vanish with the rising tides.

name: Glacier Village of Shimshal
culture: Last yak herders of the Himalayas, ancient trade route guardians
story: The highest settlement on the ancient Silk Road. Elders still speak a language with no written form, carrying stories that exist only in memory.

name: Isle de Jean Charles
culture: Biloxi-Chitimacha-Choctaw tribe, America's first climate refugees
story: 98% of the island has disappeared since 1955. The tribe that has lived here for generations is being forcibly relocated. Document their final days.

name: Tuvalu Islands
culture: Polynesian navigation traditions, traditional fishing ceremonies
story: An entire nation preparing to become the first country erased by climate change. Their government has already purchased land in Fiji for evacuation.

name: Ayoreo-Totobiegosode Territory
culture: One of the last uncontacted tribes in South America
story: Some members have never seen outsiders. Their forest home is being bulldozed for cattle. When they emerge, their 10,000-year-old way of life ends.

name: Venice Historic Center
culture: Gondoliers, glass blowers of Murano, original Venetian families
story: Only 50,000 original Venetians remain, down from 175,000 in 1950. The authentic Venice—not the tourist facade—is dying.

name: Dead Sea Shores
culture: Ancient salt harvesting traditions, therapeutic mud traditions
story: Losing 1 meter of depth per year. The shoreline has retreated 30km. Hotels built in the 1980s now stand 2km from the water.

name: Aral Sea Fishing Villages
culture: Ghost towns of former fishermen, ship graveyards in desert
story: Once the 4th largest lake on Earth, now 90% gone. Rusting ships sit 100km from water. Last fishermen share stories of abundance.

name: Ganga Aarti Ghats of Varanasi
culture: Ancient Brahmin families performing 3000-year-old rituals, traditional boat makers
story: The sacred Ganga is dying. Ancient priest families are leaving as pollution makes traditional ceremonies impossible. The spiritual heart of Hinduism faces extinction.

name: Khonoma Village Green Terraces
culture: Angami Naga tribe's sustainable farming, traditional warrior culture, headhunting stories
story: India's first green village practices 700-year-old sustainable farming. Young people leave for cities, taking ancient knowledge with them.

name: Majuli River Island Monasteries
culture: Vaishnavite monks, traditional mask making, Sattriya dance
story: The world's largest river island is disappearing. 400-year-old monasteries are being swallowed by the Brahmaputra. Monks are the last keepers of dying arts.

name: Kutch Desert Salt Pans
culture: Agariyas salt farmers, traditional salt harvesting, desert nomads
story: Families have harvested salt here for 600 years. Industrial salt production and water scarcity threaten this ancient livelihood and the pristine white desert.

name: Spiti Valley Ancient Monasteries
culture: Tibetan Buddhist monks, ancient manuscripts, traditional medicine
story: 1000-year-old monasteries in the world's coldest desert. Rising temperatures melt permafrost, cracking ancient walls. Young monks leave for warmer regions.

name: Chilika Lake Fishing Villages
culture: Traditional fishermen, dolphin watchers, migratory bird guides
story: Asia's largest brackish water lagoon is shrinking. Traditional fishing communities lose their livelihood as the lake ecosystem collapses from pollution and climate change.

name: Hampi Ruins Living Heritage
culture: Temple priests, traditional stone carvers, Vijayanagara descendants
story: The last Vijayanagara Empire capital. Ancient families still perform rituals in 500-year-old temples. Illegal mining threatens the UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Andaman Jarawa Tribal Reserves
culture: One of the last Stone Age tribes, traditional hunting, ancient language
story: 400 Jarawa people remain, living as their ancestors did 60,000 years ago. Each contact with outsiders risks destroying their immunity and culture forever.

name: Kerala Backwater Traditional Houseboats
culture: Traditional boat builders, coconut coir workers, backwater fishermen
story: Families have built boats without nails for 800 years, using only coconut coir and wood. Pollution and modern materials threaten this ancient craft.

name: Thar Desert Camel Herders
culture: Raika camel herders, traditional desert navigation, folk music
story: Raika families have bred camels for 1000 years. Trucks replace camel caravans. The last nomadic herders struggle as ancient trade routes disappear.

name: Darjeeling Tea Garden Heritage
culture: Tea garden workers, traditional tea processing, Himalayan communities
story: 150-year-old tea gardens face climate change. Rising temperatures push tea cultivation higher up mountains. Traditional workers' families face uncertain futures.

name: Goa Traditional Feni Distilleries
culture: Traditional feni makers, cashew farmers, Portuguese-influenced culture
story: Families distill feni from cashew and palm for 400 years. Tourism development replaces cashew groves with hotels. Ancient recipes risk being lost forever.

name: Ladakh High Altitude Villages
culture: Buddhist farmers, traditional architecture, ancient trade routes
story: Villages at 4000m altitude face water crisis as glaciers melt. Young people leave for cities. Ancient farming techniques that sustained life in the desert mountains are disappearing.

name: Mumbai Koli Fishing Communities
culture: Original Mumbai inhabitants, traditional fishing, coastal goddess worship
story: Mumbai's original inhabitants, the Koli fishermen, are being pushed out by skyscrapers. Their 2000-year-old fishing traditions face extinction as the sea becomes too polluted.

name: Arunachal Pradesh Tribal Villages
culture: 26 different tribes, animist traditions, traditional crafts
story: India's most linguistically diverse state. Each tribe has unique traditions. Modern education and migration threaten 26 distinct cultures and languages.

name: Pushkar Camel Fair Traditions
culture: Camel traders, folk musicians, traditional livestock dealers
story: 1000-year-old camel fair becomes tourist spectacle. Real camel traders are outnumbered by tourists. Ancient livestock trading traditions are being commercialized out of existence.

name: Coorg Coffee Plantation Heritage
culture: Kodava coffee growers, traditional processing methods, estate workers
story: 150-year-old family coffee estates face climate change. Rising temperatures push coffee cultivation to higher altitudes. Traditional shade-grown methods are being abandoned.

name: Konark Sun Temple Stone Carvers
culture: Traditional stone carvers, temple sculptors, ancient techniques
story: Families who carved the Sun Temple for generations now work in modern construction. Ancient stone carving techniques that created UNESCO wonders are disappearing.

name: Rann of Kutch Salt Workers
culture: Agariyas salt farmers, traditional salt harvesting, desert survival skills
story: Families harvest salt from the white desert for 600 years. Industrial production and water scarcity threaten this ancient livelihood in the world's largest salt desert.

name: Banaras Silk Weavers
culture: Traditional silk weavers, Banarasi saree makers, family looms
story: Families weave silk for 500 years in narrow Varanasi lanes. Machine-made sarees and cheap imports force master weavers into poverty. Ancient patterns risk being lost forever.

name: Nilgiri Mountain Railway Heritage
culture: Steam engine operators, traditional railway workers, hill station heritage
story: 130-year-old toy train climbs through tea gardens using steam technology. Pressure to modernize threatens this UNESCO World Heritage railway and its traditional operations.

name: Khasi Living Root Bridges
culture: Khasi tribe, traditional bridge builders, forest guardians
story: Khasi people grow bridges from living tree roots over 15 years. Modern concrete bridges and youth migration threaten this unique 500-year-old bio-engineering tradition.

name: Bishnoi Wildlife Conservation Villages
culture: Bishnoi community, wildlife protectors, traditional conservation
story: Bishnoi people protect wildlife for 500 years, never cutting green trees or killing animals. Modern development and water scarcity threaten their conservation villages.

name: Chettinad Mansion Architecture
culture: Chettiar merchants, traditional architects, lime mortar specialists
story: Merchant families built 10,000 mansions with materials from around the world. Families migrate to cities, leaving architectural marvels to decay. Traditional building skills are dying.

name: Toda Tribal Dairy Traditions
culture: Toda tribe, sacred buffalo herding, traditional dairy practices
story: Only 1,600 Toda people remain in Nilgiri hills. Their sacred relationship with buffalo and unique dairy traditions face extinction as young people adopt modern lifestyles.

name: Jaisalmer Havelis Stone Craft
culture: Traditional stone carvers, haveli builders, desert architects
story: Families carved golden sandstone havelis for 800 years. Tourism pressure and quarrying restrictions threaten the craft that built the Golden City's architectural wonders.

name: Manipur Loktak Lake Fishing Villages
culture: Traditional fishermen, floating hut dwellers, lake ecosystem guardians
story: Fishermen live on floating biomass islands for centuries. Pollution and dam construction destroy the unique ecosystem. The world's only floating national park faces collapse.

name: Warli Tribal Art Villages
culture: Warli tribe, traditional wall painters, ritual art practices
story: Warli people paint their stories on mud walls for 3,000 years. Commercial art market strips away ritual meaning. Traditional village context disappears as youth migrate to cities.

name: Sikkim Monastery Mask Dance Traditions
culture: Buddhist monks, traditional mask makers, sacred dance performers
story: Monks perform sacred Cham dances in 400-year-old monasteries. Young monks leave for modern education. Ancient mask-making and dance traditions risk disappearing from Himalayan valleys.

name: Pulicat Lake Traditional Fishing
culture: Traditional fishermen, flamingo watchers, salt pan workers
story: India's second-largest brackish water lake supports 20,000 fishermen. Industrial pollution and climate change shrink the lake. Traditional fishing communities face displacement.

name: Jharkhand Tribal Iron Smelting
culture: Asur tribe, traditional iron smelters, forest metal workers
story: Asur tribe smelts iron using 2,000-year-old techniques in forest furnaces. Mining destroys their forests. The last traditional iron smelters in India face extinction.

name: Channapatna Wooden Toy Makers
culture: Traditional toy makers, lacquer workers, wooden craft families
story: Families carve wooden toys for 200 years using natural lacquer. Plastic toys flood markets. Traditional artisans struggle as children prefer electronic toys over handmade wooden ones.
